title: What's the difference between ubiquitous computing and cloud computing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ubiquitous simply means being everywhere and the word ubiquitous computing has no relation with cloud computing. Think of ubiquitous computing as an idea which stresses the proliferation of computing in all aspects of human society and our increase dependence on it. This has become obvious with the rise of the internet and mobile computing. Because cloud computing uses the internet to deliver services(hardware and software)  one can argue that cloud computing is an enabler of ubiquitous(any time, any place) computing for certain types of applications.

It's the difference between 'consumer' and 'provider'.  I think of ubiquitous as the always-on platforms embodied by smart phones and touch screen mobile devices.  I think of the cloud as being where they consume on-demand services.  They are growing largely in lockstep.
